LanguageData.NeedSlaveBedsDesc:
You have more slaves than you have slave beds. Someone will lack a place to sleep.

Either make more beds, or change a colonist or prisoner bed to a slave bed.

If you have no resources, sleeping spots are free and can be placed instantly.
LanguageData.SlavesUnsuppressedDesc: {0_nameDef}'s suppression level is dangerously low. There is a good chance {0_pronoun} will rebel.\n\nMake sure there is a colonist assigned to warden work. Wardens will suppress slaves periodically to stop them from rebelling.
LanguageData.SlavesUnattendedDesc: Some slaves are alone on a map with no able-bodied colonists around.\n\nSlaves left unattended like this are very likely to rebel within days or hours.
LanguageData.RitualTargetsExplanation: To begin the ritual, select a focus object and click the 'Begin {RITUAL_label}' command. The following are valid focus objects:\n{1}
LanguageData.RitualRolesExplanation: Following roles have a part in {RITUAL_label}:\n{1}
LanguageData.RitualUnfilledRoles: In order to perform {0} you need to fill these roles
LanguageData.IdeoBuildingRoomRequirementsDesc: In order to dignify {0}, these room requirements must be met
LanguageData.QuestPartRaidsDelayDesc: Raids will start arriving in {0}.\n\nThe raiders will target the spacedrone and attempt to destroy it. Protect the spacedrone so your colonists can hack its computer and retrieve the data.
LanguageData.IdeoRolesEmptyDesc:
These roles are not filled:
{0}

You can assign someone a role on their Social tab.

If these roles remain empty, the following people will be unhappy
LanguageData.AncientAltarThreatsWakingDesc: Security threats will activate in {0}. They will attack any who may threaten the relic.
LanguageData.AlertNoRecentSlaughterDesc: No large {0} animal has been slaughtered recently. This is a requirement of the following ideoligions
LanguageData.AlertNoRecentSlaughterDescPost: If no slaughter is performed, these colonists will remain unhappy
LanguageData.AlertRitualComingDesc: A ritual opportunity is coming soon for following rituals
LanguageData.AlertRitualComingExtra: Opportunities expire after {0} days, and reoccur on the same day each year.
LanguageData.AlertAgeReversalDemandDesc: Because of their beliefs, some of your colonists demand regular age reversal treatments in a biosculpter pod. If they don't get the treatments, they will be displeased.\n\nThe following people demand age reversal treatment
LanguageData.AlertAgeReversalDemandDesc_Recruit: {PAWN} joined {FACTION} recently, and wants to begin age reversal treatments in {DURATION}.
LanguageData.AlertRoyalTitleNoVeneratedAnimalMeat: {PAWN_nameDef}'s belief in {IDEO_name} prevents {PAWN_objective} from eating the meat of {ANIMALS}.
LanguageData.AlertGauranlenTreeWithoutDryadTypeDesc: One or more Gauranlen trees do not have their dryad caste set.\n\nSelect the tree and click the '{0}' button to set produced dryad caste.
LanguageData.AlertConnectedPawnNotAssignedToPlantCutt: Connector not assigned to plant cutting
You have Gauranlen trees which are set to be pruned, but their connectors are not assigned to plant cutting.\n\nYou should assign plant cutting work to the following people
LanguageData.AlertFuelNodeIgnitingDesc: A fuel node has ignited! It will melt down and explode very soon.\n\nGet away and be ready to fight or escape the fires.
LanguageData.AlertInfestationArrivingDesc: Giant insects have sensed your activity and are burrowing up from underground to attack. Infestations are about to begin.
LanguageData.AlertHostilesWakingUpDesc: One or more {0_pawnsPlural} are waking up.\n\nThey will attack if they find you.
LanguageData.AlertCasketOpeningDesc: Cryptosleep caskets containing unknown threats are opening soon.
LanguageData.AlertSlaveRebellionLikelyRebelliousCount: There are {REBELLIOUSCOUNT} slaves that are likely to initiate a rebellion.
LanguageData.AlertSlaveRebellionLikelyMostRebellious: A slave rebellion is expected to happen roughly once every {COMBINEDTIME}. Note that each slave's rebellion chance is independent, so if any one of them rebels they can take others with them.\n\n{REBEL_labelShort} is the most rebellious slave and is expected to initiate a rebellion roughly once every {INDIVIDUALTIME}. The following factors are affecting how often they will rebel:
LanguageData.DesignatorExtractSkullDesc: Extract the skull from a corpse.
LanguageData.ChooseStructureMemesInfo: Choose the symbolic structure of your ideoligion. This only affects symbols - it does not affect gameplay.
LanguageData.ChooseNormalMemesInfo: Choose {0}-{1} memes to form the foundational ideas of this ideoligion.
LanguageData.SomeMemesHaveMoreImpact: Some of these have much more gameplay impact than others.
LanguageData.ChooseNormalMemesFluidIdeoInfo: Choose one meme to form the initial idea of this ideoligion. You will add more memes as the ideoligion develops over time.
LanguageData.ChooseOrRemoveMeme: Choose a meme or remove a meme.
LanguageData.ChangesRandomizePrecepts: {0} will re-randomize any precepts you have edited.\n\nDo you wish to continue?
LanguageData.ChooseRoleConfirmAssign: You're about to assign the role of {ROLE_labelDef} to {PAWN_labelShort}.
LanguageData.ChooseRoleConfirmAssignReplace: {PAWN_labelShort} currently holds this role and will be unhappy to lose it.
LanguageData.ChooseRoleConfirmAssignHasOtherRole: {PAWN_labelShort} currently holds the role of {ROLE_label} and will be unhappy to lose it.
LanguageData.ChooseRoleConfirmAssignReplaceLeader: There can be only one leader. This will dismiss {PAWN_labelShort} from their {OTHERROLE_labelDef} role, which will make {PAWN_objective} upset.
LanguageData.ChooseRoleConfirmUnassign: You're about to dismiss {PAWN_labelShort} from the role of {ROLE_labelIndef}. This will upset {PAWN_objective}.
LanguageData.ChooseRoleListApparelDemands: The {ROLE_label} role requires the following apparel
LanguageData.ChooseRoleListWorkTypeRestrictions: {PAWN_labelShort} will refuse to do these work types
LanguageData.ChooseRoleHint: It can sometimes be better to wait until your colony is more established before you assign roles.
LanguageData.ChooseRoleRequiredWorkTagsDisabled: WARNING: {PAWN_nameDef} is unable to do work that is required for the role of {ROLE_label}. If you choose to give {PAWN_objective} this role, {PAWN_pronoun} may be unable to use the abilities associated with {ROLE_label}. The missing work types are
LanguageData.CannotNotAddRoleApparelDueToMeme: The meme {MEME} prevents adding apparel requirements to roles.
LanguageData.ReformIdeoligionDesc: Reform your ideoligion by changing its structure, memes or style.
LanguageData.NegotiatorWillNotTradeSlaves: Negotiator will not sell people into slavery.
LanguageData.NegotiatorWillNotTradeSlavesTip: The negotiator, {0_nameDef}, will not people into slavery due to {0_possessive} belief in {1}.\n\nNote that {0_nameDef} is willing to ransom someone back to their own faction, but isn't willing to sell someone to a different faction.
LanguageData.LastHumanMeatDesc: Because of {PAWN_possessive} belief in {IDEO_name}, {PAWN_nameDef} will become unhappy if {PAWN_pronoun} goes more than {DURATION} days without eating human meat.
LanguageData.ExectueNeutralFactionSlave: Executing {PAWN_labelShort} will negatively affect relations with {FACTION_name}.
LanguageData.CaravanMustHaveAtLeastOneNonSlaveColonis: You must assign at least one non-slave colonist who can walk.
LanguageData.SourceCaravanMustHaveAtLeastOneNonSlaveC: You must leave at least non-slave colonist who can walk.
LanguageData.PawnUnhappyWithStyleItems: {PAWN_nameDef} will be unhappy with the following
LanguageData.StyleCategoryDescription: Style categories affect the appearance of some buildings, apparel and weapons made by {IDEO_memberNamePlural}. If more than one category affects the same thing, the left-most one applies.
LanguageData.StyleCategoryDescriptionAbstract: Style categories affect the appearance of some buildings, apparel and weapons made by your colony. If more than one category affects the same thing, the left-most one applies.
LanguageData.StyleCategoryDescStyleDominance: {IDEO_memberNamePlural} will be happy if they notice buildings, floors, and art matching this style.
LanguageData.StyleCategoryDescStyleDominanceAbstract: Ideoligion members will be happy if they notice buildings, floors, and art matching this style.
LanguageData.HairAndBeardsDesc: These settings determine how frequently each style appears on members of this ideoligion.
LanguageData.TattoosDesc: These settings determines how frequently each tattoo appears on members of this ideoligion.
LanguageData.ResetButtonDesc: Resets all style items to their default values.
LanguageData.TooltipDyeExplanation: Dye can be farmed from tinctoria or purchased from traders.
LanguageData.ChooseProductionModeInitialDesc: Here you can choose which caste of dryads this {TREE_label} will create.\n\nDryads will emerge from pods that grow at the tree's base. The maximum number of dryads is based on the connection strength between {TREE_definite} and the connected person.
LanguageData.ChooseColonistsForIdeoTitle: Choose who to convert to your ideoligion
LanguageData.ChooseColonistsForIdeoDesc: You may convert people to your primary ideoligion when setting up a new colony.
LanguageData.ChooseThingsForNewColonyDesc: Choose which colonists, animals and relics to bring to the new colony.
LanguageData.ChooseOnlySlavesInfo: If you only select slaves, you will play them as colonists in the next colony.
LanguageData.ShipEscapeWillEndDescription: The hibernating starship reported by the AI (*Name)Charlon Whitestone(/Name) will fly away by the time the new colony is established. It will no longer be possible to escape the planet by traveling to this ship.
LanguageData.RemoveEquippedRelicsDescription: The colony's purchasers will only allow you to take one relic. Any relic not selected will be left behind, including:
LanguageData.AbandonArchotechStructuresWarningDialog: You are abandoning a site that contains archotech structures which you have not yet fully studied.\n\nYou will be able to resettle here later, but your colony will be wiped away.
LanguageData.ItemQuantityTooltip: {0} quantity that can be brought to the new colony.\n\nThe maximum allowed quantity is: {1}
LanguageData.ConfirmHackEnenyTerminal: Hacking this {0} will alert enemies and cause them to attack. Do really want to hack {0}?
LanguageData.StatsReport_RelicAtRitualMoodBonus: Mood bonus for rituals in room
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_RelicOf_Desc: The ideology this relic belongs to.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_RelatedToIdeos_Desc: The ideoligions this thing belongs to.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_StyleDominanceCategoryDesc: The style presented by this object. This style may be associated with some ideoligions. Different people respond differently to certain styles, according to their ideoligious beliefs.
LanguageData.Stat_Pawn_DarknessCombatShooting_Desc: An offset applied to the chance to hit a target based on the target's light level.
LanguageData.Stat_Pawn_DarknessMeleeDodgeChance_Desc: An offset applied to the melee dodge chance based on the target's light level.
LanguageData.Stat_Pawn_DarknessMeleeHitChance_Desc: An offset applied to the melee hit chance based on the target's light level.
LanguageData.Stat_PawnDarkness_FollowingOffset: The following offsets can be applied
LanguageData.CantStartRitualTargetIsAlreadyInRitual: {0} is already participating in a ritual.
LanguageData.CantStartRitualRoleNotAssigned: You must assign the role of {0} in order to start this ritual.
LanguageData.CantStartRitualNoConvertee: There is nobody to convert to {0}. You need a colonist, prisoner, or slave of a different ideoligion.
LanguageData.CantStartNotEnoughSpaceDuel: Not enough space. There must be a clear circle of radius {MINRADIUS}.
LanguageData.CantStartFuneralForSlave: {0_labelShort} is a slave. Slaves don't get funerals.
LanguageData.NoSlaveBed: Need a slave bed that is reachable, not reserved, and in safe temperature.
LanguageData.BodyPartAlreadyCovered: cannot be worn with assigned apparel
LanguageData.NoteRoleApparelRequirementEffects: People are pleased when their apparel requirements are fulfilled, and unhappy when they are violated.
LanguageData.UnderMinBiosculpterAgeReversalAge: Must be {0} years old for age reversal.
LanguageData.CommandBedSetForOwnerTypeDesc: Whether beds in this room should be used by colonists, prisoners or slaves.
LanguageData.CommandNeuralSuperchargerNoAutoUseDescri: None of your people will use this neural supercharger automatically.
LanguageData.CommandNeuralSuperchargerAutoUseWithDesi: Your people may use this neural supercharger automatically, if they want to because of their beliefs.
LanguageData.CommandNeuralSuperchargerAutoForEveryone: All of your people will use this neural supercharger if they get the chance.
LanguageData.CommandNeuralSuperchargerAllowGuestsDesc: Allow this neural supercharger to be used by temporary faction members.
LanguageData.CommandHealInHealingPodDesc: If this creature is injured, it will return to its connected Gauranlen tree and enter a woody healing pod. After {DAYS} days, the dryad will emerge with its wounds healed.
LanguageData.SlaveReleaseRelationGainsDesc: The faction goodwill you will gain if you release a slave. This is affected by the slaves's physical and mental health.
LanguageData.SlaveRebellionMTBDaysDescription: The average number of days between slave rebellion attempts. Only time awake is counted. This is affected by suppression, mood, health, proximity to weapons, the number of slaves on the map, and the presence of colonists on the map.
LanguageData.SuppressionDesc: Suppression is the psychological effect of fear and control on a slave. If suppression is low, slaves are more likely to rebel.
LanguageData.SuppressionFallRateDesc:
Suppression falls over time depending on its current level:

- {1}+ suppression: {0} per day
- {4}-{3} suppression: {2} per day
- {6}- suppression: {5} per day

Apparel and terror can also affect the suppression fall rate. This slave's fall rate calculation is
LanguageData.TerrorDescription: Terror is a way to keep slaves suppressed. It rises when the slave spends time near terrifying things like terror sculptures. A slave can only be affected by three terror sources at a time.\n\nWhile terror is high, suppression falls slower as follows
LanguageData.SuppressionRebellionAnySlave: At least one of the {0} slaves on this map is expected rebel on average every {1}.
LanguageData.WillLevelDesc: How much the prisoner is determined not to submit. When this reaches zero, they can be enslaved.
LanguageData.IdeoConversionTargetDesc: The ideoligion your wardens will attempt to convert this prisoner to.
LanguageData.CertaintyChangePerDay: Change per day due to mood
LanguageData.RoleDesc: A special status this person holds in their ideoligion. If you change or take away this role, they will become unhappy.
LanguageData.ConversionWeakerDueToTraitAgreements: Conversion attempts will be weaker because of trait/meme agreement
LanguageData.ConversionStrongerDueToTraitAgreements: Conversion attempts will be stronger because of trait/meme conflict
LanguageData.LetterConvertIdeoAttempt_Success: {INITIATOR_nameDef} has successfully turned {RECIPIENT_nameDef} away from {OLDIDEO_name} and towards {IDEO_name}.
LanguageData.LetterSingleSlaveRebellion: {0_nameDef} is rebelling! {0_pronoun} will seek weapons and try to eliminate your colonists.
LanguageData.SlaveRebellionSuppressionExplanation: Slaves are more likely to rebel when their suppression level is low.
LanguageData.LetterLabelRoleActiveDesc: The number of {0}s in your colony has reached {1}. You can now assign the role of {ROLE_labelDef} to one of your colonists.\n\nTo assign a role, select a colonist, go to their 'Social' tab and press the 'Choose role' button.
LanguageData.LetterLabelRoleInactiveDesc: Number of {0}s in your colony fell to {1}. {ROLE_labelDef} role is no longer active. This role will become available once again when the number of {0}s reaches {2}.
LanguageData.LetterRoleLostDesc: {PAWN_labelShort} no longer holds the role of {ROLE_labelIndef}. Reason:
LanguageData.LetterRoleLostReasonLowBelieversDesc: Role became inactive due to low {0} count.
LanguageData.LetterRoleLostLetterIdeoChangedPostfix: {PAWN_labelShort} has lost {PAWN_possessive} position as {ROLE_labelDef} because {PAWN_pronoun} abandoned the {OLDIDEO_name}.
LanguageData.LetterObligationRoleInactiveDateDesc: {0} is the date of the {1}, but since {ROLE_labelDef} role is inactive, the {2}s will skip the {1}.
LanguageData.LetterTitleObligationsDeactivatedTooFewB: There are now less than {1} {IDEO_memberNamePlural} in your faction. Therefore, the {IDEO_memberNamePlural} will not demand that the rituals of {IDEO} be carried out until there are at least {1} of them in your faction.
LanguageData.LetterTitleObligationsActivatedEnoughBel: Since there are now {1} {IDEO_memberNamePlural} in your faction, they will demand that the rituals of {IDEO} be carried out.
LanguageData.LetterTitleObligationsActivatedIdeoBecam: Since {IDEO} is now the primary ideoligion of your faction, {IDEO_memberNamePlural} will demand that the rituals of {IDEO} be carried out.
LanguageData.LetterBondRemovedDesc: {PAWN_nameDef} has converted to {IDEO}. Since {IDEO} disapproves of bonding with animals, {PAWN_pronoun} has renounced {PAWN_possessive} bonds with the following animals:\n\n{BONDS}
LanguageData.LetterNewPrimaryIdeo:
Your faction's primary ideoligion has changed from {OLDIDEO_name} to {NEWIDEO_name}.

This happened because {NEWIDEO_name} is now more common among your {FACTION_pawnsPlural} than any other ideoligion.

Your primary ideoligion affects relationships with other factions, based on how closely your beliefs align with theirs.
LanguageData.JoinerCharityInfo: This is a charity incident. If you turn {0} away, believers with charitable beliefs will be unhappy.
LanguageData.AfflictedJoinerChartityInfo: This is a charity incident. If {0} dies without being tended (and after {1}), believers with charitable beliefs will be unhappy. If {0} is tended or recruited, believers will be happy.
LanguageData.PawnsHaveCharitableBeliefs: The following believers have charitable beliefs
LanguageData.LetterIdeoChangeConverted: {PAWN_pronoun} decided that {PAWN_possessive} belief in {OLDIDEO_name} no longer made any sense.\n\n{PAWN_pronoun} now believes in {NEWIDEO_name}.
LanguageData.LetterIdeoChangeNotConverted: {PAWN_nameDef}'s certainty with {PAWN_possessive} belief in {OLDIDEO_name} has been reduced to {NEWCERTAINTY}.
LanguageData.LetterIdeoChangedWanderOwnRoom: To come to terms with {PAWN_possessive} beliefs, {PAWN_nameDef} is now hiding in {PAWN_possessive} room.
LanguageData.LetterIdeoChangedSadWander: {PAWN_nameDef} is now wandering in shock while grappling with {PAWN_possessive} beliefs.
LanguageData.LetterSurpriseReinforcements: Surprise reinforcements from {1} have arrived! They are moving to help {0} from {1}.
LanguageData.LetterWantLookChangeDesc: {PAWN_nameDef} wishes to change {PAWN_possessive} look, as it no longer matches what {PAWN_pronoun} believes.\n\n{PAWN_pronoun} will automatically use an available styling station and choose a look. If you want to customize {PAWN_possessive} look, select {PAWN_objective} and right-click the styling station.
LanguageData.LetterTextRaidSpacedrone: A raid from {0} has arrived to destroy the {1} that was forced to land nearby.
LanguageData.LetterTextSpacedroneHacked: You've finished hacking the {0} and learned more about the ancient {1} relic.
LanguageData.LetterOnlySlaveCaravanColonistsLeft: All non-slave members of {0} have died. The remaining slaves have walked away. The caravan has disabanded.
LanguageData.LetterTextLastHackerLost: The last hacker capable of unlocking the secrets of the ancient complex has been lost. Call reinforcements capable of hacking, or abandon the quest.
LanguageData.LetterTextRelicFoundLocation: You've finally learned the location of the relic {0}!
LanguageData.LetterTextRelicFoundSecurityThreats: The relic is housed in an ancient structure. It is protected by a security system with multiple independent units. You may choose to defeat the security forces one unit at a time before taking the relic, or try to grab it and flee before they can harm you.\n\nAfter {0}, all security systems will be alerted.
LanguageData.LetterTextRelicsCollected: All relics belonging to {0} have been collected. The following people will be delighted
LanguageData.LetterTextPawnConnected:
{CONNECTOR_nameDef} has connected with {TREE_definite}.

{TREE_definite} will produce small animals called dryads by growing them in pods at its base. These dryads can specialize into different castes. You can choose which caste of dryads you want the tree to produce.

The stronger the connection between tree and human, the more dryads {TREE_definite} can sustain. {CONNECTOR_nameDef} can strengthen the connection by pruning {TREE_definite}. Maintaining a higher connection strength requires more frequent pruning.
LanguageData.LetterTextConnectedTreeDestroyed: A {TREE_label} connected to {CONNECTEDPAWN_nameDef} has been destroyed, killing the dryad queen housed inside.\n\nWithout a queen, the dryad brood-mind has collapsed. All dryads from that tree have died.
LanguageData.LetterTextArchonexusWealthReached: You have reached the wealth requirement for the quest '{0}'. You can now accept the quest.
LanguageData.LetterTextArchonexusStructureResearched:
You have completed your study of the {0_labelShort}.

You can't say that you understand it in any complete way, but you have detected patterns in its behavior and the way it seems to express information.

With this knowledge, you will be able to interpret the next piece of the archonexus map.
LanguageData.LetterTextArchotechStructuresAbandoned: You have abandoned the archotech structures at {0_definite}.\n\nDistant observers say they saw a great flash emanating from this location not long after you left.
LanguageData.LetterTextReformIdeo:
You have enough development points to reform {0}!

Reforming allows you to do one of the following:

- Add a meme
- Remove a meme
- Change structure
- Change style

You can also make unlimited changes to precepts, deities, narrative text, and other symbols.

To reform the ideoligion, open it in the ideoligions tab.
LanguageData.CoreNarrativeDesc: The core narrative of your ideoligion. This has no gameplay impact.
LanguageData.LockButtonDesc: Lock or unlock the ideoligion's narrative. When locked, the narrative text will not auto-regenerate if the ideoligion is changed.
LanguageData.LockInOn: {0} lock is currently on. The {1} will not auto-regenerate.
LanguageData.LockInOff: {0} lock is currently off. The {1} text can auto-regenerate.
LanguageData.LockPreceptNameButtonDesc: Lock or unlock the name of this precept. When locked, the precept name will not auto-regenerate if the ideoligion is changed.
LanguageData.CultureTip: Culture affects names, appearances, and symbols.
LanguageData.StructureMemeTip: An ideoligion's structure determines the kind of entities and forces it sees as important to the moral structure of the universe. It has no direct gameplay effects.
LanguageData.RandomizeSymbolsTooltip: Randomize ideoligion name, icon, narrative, leader title and any other texts like ritual names or role names. This does not affect gameplay elements like memes or precepts.
LanguageData.ClickAnyElementToEditIt: Click any element to edit it
LanguageData.Name: Name
LanguageData.IdeoCharityQuestInfo: This is a charity quest. If you don't fulfill it, believers in {0} will be unhappy due to their charitable beliefs. If you do, believers in {0} will be happy ({1}).
LanguageData.WorkDisabledSlave: Slaves will not do this work
LanguageData.CharityQuestTip: This is a charity quest. People with charitable beliefs will be affected by its outcome.
LanguageData.RelicTip: Relics are objects of spiritual or ideological significance. They can be discovered by completing long and dangerous quests. A relic can be installed in a reliquary to attract pilgrims, enhance rituals, and strengthen an ideoligion's ability to convert outsiders.
LanguageData.IdeoImpactOverallDesc: Some memes impact gameplay more than others. The meme's impact score gives a sense of how big of a gameplay impact it has.
LanguageData.InitialPlayerIdeo: This was your colony's starting ideoligion.
LanguageData.FluidIdeoTip:
Since this ideoligion is so new and has so few followers on this planet, it is fluid. This means that it can develop over time.

Developing the ideoligion costs development points. You can earn development points by completing rituals and quests related to this ideoligion.

With enough development points, you can reform the ideoligion with new memes, precepts, styles, and more.
LanguageData.ResearchProjectHasDefsWithMissingMemes: {0} unlocks things which you cannot build because they require memes that none of your people believe
LanguageData.SelectedWorkTypeOpposedByIdeo: Warning: This kind of work is opposed by {0_possessive} ideoligion, so it may make this person unhappy.
LanguageData.MessageMustChooseIdeo: Create or select an ideoligion for your faction.
LanguageData.MessageIdeoNameCantBeEmpty: The ideoligion name can't be empty.
LanguageData.MessageIdeoWarnRoleApparelOverlapsDesire: {DESIREDAPPAREL} apparel desire overlaps with {ROLE} apparel requirement.
LanguageData.DescriptionIdeoWarnRoleApparelOverlapsDe: {DESIREDAPPAREL} overlaps with {ROLE} apparel requirement ({ROLEAPPAREL}). This will make it impossible for {ROLE}s to wear the required and desired apparel together.
LanguageData.MessagePawnUnwillingToDoDueToIdeo: {0_labelShort} refuses to do this because of {0_possessive} ideoligion.
LanguageData.MessageFailedConvertIdeoAttempt: {INITIATOR_nameDef} tried to convert {RECIPIENT_nameDef} to {INITIATOR_possessive} ideoligion. {RECIPIENT_nameDef}'s certainty has fallen from {CERTAINTYBEFORE} to {CERTAINTYAFTER}. {RECIPIENT_pronoun} resents the conversion attempt.
LanguageData.MessageFailedConvertIdeoAttemptSocialFig: {PAWN1_nameDef} tried to convert {PAWN2_nameDef} to {PAWN1_possessive} ideoligion. This led to a social fight!
LanguageData.MessageNotEnoughMemes: You must choose at least {0} memes.
LanguageData.MessageTooManyMemes: You can't choose more than {0} memes.
LanguageData.MessageNotEnoughStructureMemes: You must choose a structure meme.
LanguageData.MessageIncompatibleMemes: {0_label} and {1_label} are incompatible with each other.
LanguageData.MessageNeedAssignedRoleToBeginRitual: Before starting the {1}, you must assign someone to the role of {0}.
LanguageData.MessageRoleUnassignedPrisoner: Since {0_labelShort} became a prisoner, {0_pronoun} no longer can hold the role of {1}.
LanguageData.MessageWarningPlayerDesignatedTreeChoppe: Warning: {0} will be upset if a tree is cut.
LanguageData.MessageWarningPlayerDesignatedMining: Warning: {0} will be upset if mining occurs.
LanguageData.MessageConnectedPawnDied: The {TREE_label} has had its connection with {PAWN_nameDef} torn. It must recover for {DURATION} before it can reconnect again.
LanguageData.MessagePrisonerWillBroken: Prisoner {1_nameDef}'s will has been broken by {0_nameDef}.
LanguageData.MessageNoWardenCapableOfEnslavement: No warden is capable of this enslavement.
LanguageData.MessageNoWardenOfIdeo: You have no {MEMBERNAME} wardens to convert {PRISONER_nameDef}. {PRISONER_possessive} interaction mode has reverted to "No interaction".
LanguageData.MessageCampDetected: You've detected a {CAMP_label} nearby controlled by {FACTION_name}.
LanguageData.CannotRemoveMemeRequiredPlayer: Cannot remove {MEME}: Required by player faction.
LanguageData.OverlappingRoleApparel: Roles cannot have overlapping apparel requirements.
LanguageData.MessageAncientTerminalDiscovered: You've discovered an ancient terminal with info about the {0}!
LanguageData.MessageAncientComplexBackToShuttle: You've discovered secret information about {0}! Get back on the shuttle to launch it.
LanguageData.MessageAncientSignalActivated: An ancient supply satellite has been activated. Supplies will drop nearby.
LanguageData.MessageAncientSignalHostileDetected: {0} from the {1} have detected the supply signal and are attacking.
LanguageData.MessageAncientAltarThreatsWokenUp: All security systems are waking up!
LanguageData.MessageAncientAltarThreatsAlerted: All security systems are alerted to your presence.
LanguageData.MessageAnimalIsVeneratedForAllColonists: Warning: {PAWNKINDLABELPLURAL} are venerated by all {PAWNS}, and will not be harmed.
LanguageData.MessageNewColonyMax: Select at most {0} {1} to bring to the new colony.
LanguageData.MessageNewColoyRequiresOneColonist: You must select at least 1 colonist.
LanguageData.MessageFuelNodeTriggered: A {0} has been ignited and is going to explode!
LanguageData.MessageFuelNodeDelayActivated: {0} was disturbed and might explode soon!
LanguageData.RandomStructureTip: A random structure will be used for your ideoligion.
LanguageData.RandomStyleTip: A random style will be used for your ideoligion.
LanguageData.ChooseYourIdeoligionDesc: What should your starting colonists believe? These beliefs affect gameplay and visuals. You’ll be able to recruit others to your beliefs, or take on their beliefs.
LanguageData.SelectAnIdeo: Select an ideoligion for your faction on the left, or
LanguageData.CurrentTotalAnimalBodySizePerColonist: Current total animal bodysize per colonist
LanguageData.MinAnimalBodySizePerColonist: Expecting at least {0} body size per colonist.
LanguageData.PlantThingDesc: Plant a {0_label} in a chosen area.
LanguageData.FavoriteColorTooltip: {PAWN_labelShort}'s favorite color. Having more than {PERCENTAGE} of {PAWN_possessive} apparel in this color, or the color of {PAWN_possessive} ideoligion, will make {PAWN_objective} slightly happier.\n\nYou can alter apparel colors at the styling station using tinctoria dye.
LanguageData.NotEnoughDyeWillRecolorApparel: The colonist will recolor the apparel when dye becomes available.
LanguageData.NotEnoughDyeWillRecolorHair: The colonist will recolor their hair when dye becomes available.
LanguageData.Reward_DevelopmentPoints:
Your development points for {0} will increase by {1}.

You currently have {2} development points. Once you have {3} development points you can reform the ideologion.

Earn additional development points by completing other quests and rituals.
LanguageData.RitualTargetEmptyGraveInfo: An empty grave to mourn {PAWN_labelShort}'s passing.
LanguageData.RitualTargetEmptyGraveInfoAbstract: An empty grave to mourn {IDEO_memberNameIndef}'s passing.
LanguageData.RitualTargetGatherSpotInfo: Any gathering spot, like a table
LanguageData.RitualTargetLightBallInfo: A lightball or ritual spot. Lightball and loudspeakers must be powered.
LanguageData.RitualTargetNeedUnroofedCells: Need at least {0} unroofed cells nearby.
LanguageData.RitualTargetCampfirePartyInfo: A lit campfire or ritual spot.
LanguageData.RitualTargetCampfireSkylanternsInfo: A lit campfire or ritual spot. Spot must be unroofed with at least 25 unroofed cells in the area.
LanguageData.RitualTargetConnectionTornGauranlenTree: {TREE_definite} has had its connection torn recently. It can connect again in {1}.
LanguageData.RitualTargeWoodInfo: You need {0} wood for each participant ({2} total). You have {1} wood.
LanguageData.RitualScarificationWarnNonScarificationI: {PAWN_labelShort} does not believe in ideoligious scarification and will not like being scarified.
LanguageData.RitualScarificationWarnWimp: {PAWN_labelShort} is a wimp and will not like being scarified.
LanguageData.RitualBlindingWarnNonBlindingIdeo: {PAWN_labelShort} does not believe in ideoligious blinding and will not like being blinded.
LanguageData.RitualBlindingWarnWimp: {PAWN_labelShort} is a wimp and will not like being blinded.
LanguageData.RitualOutcomeExtraDesc_DancePartyWorkFoc: Everyone participating in the ritual gained a one-day work focus buff ({PERCENTAGE} global work speed)!
LanguageData.RitualOutcomeExtraDesc_BlindingPsylink: Thanks to a satisfying blinding ritual, {PAWN_labelShort} gained a psylink level!
LanguageData.RitualOutcomeExtraDesc_BlindingPsylinkAb: With a new pyslink level {PAWN_pronoun} gained a {0} psycast.
LanguageData.RitualOutcomeExtraDesc_SkylanternWandere: Your skylanterns have attracted some friendly travelers. They will visit and leave a gift.
LanguageData.RitualOutcomeExtraDesc_Execution: All participating slaves were shaken by the sight of death. Their suppression has been raised to its maximum level.
LanguageData.RitualAttachedOutcome_FarmAnimalsWanderI: The commotion from the {0} has attracted some curious animals!\n\nThey seem accustomed to human contact and are joining the colony.
LanguageData.RitualAttachedOutcome_GauranlenTreePod_E: The {0} has induced a Gauranlen pod to sprout nearby.
LanguageData.RitualAttachedOutcomeCantApply_AncientCo: There is already a known ancient complex to explore.
LanguageData.IdeoBuildingVariationOf: This building is a variation of
LanguageData.RitualRepeatPenaltyTip: Repeating a ritual within {0} days reduces its quality. {1} days have passed since the last ritual, so the current quality reduction is {2}. This penalty will fall to zero {3} days from now.
LanguageData.RitualOutcomeCompTip_RitualTargetDefsPar: For best quality, start the {0} at {1}.
Currently, the {0} is being started at {1_labelShortIndef}.
LanguageData.RitualDevelopmentPointsTip: Completing this ritual gives {0}-{1} development points depending on quality.
LanguageData.SellingAsSlave: If you sell someone to any faction besides their own, they become slaves.
LanguageData.SellingAsRansom: If you sell someone to their own faction, they are ransomed and not enslaved.
LanguageData.RoleBelieverCountDesc: This role becomes active when your faction has {1} {0}. It becomes inactive when your faction has only {3} {2}.
LanguageData.RoleRaisedExpectationGracePeriod: The {0} will have higher expectations in {1}.
LanguageData.AbilityDisabledNoAltarOrRitualsSpot: No reachable altar or ritual spot.
LanguageData.EmancipateNonCololonistWithFactionToolti: The slave will leave the map on foot and return to their home faction, {0}.
LanguageData.EmancipateNonCololonistWithoutFactionToo: The slave will leave on foot and exit the map.
LanguageData.EmancipateCololonistTooltip: The slave will return to being a colonist.
LanguageData.WorshippedTerminalFactionBecameHostileTi: You've stayed in the village too long. The people of {FACTION_name} are attacking!
LanguageData.WorshippedTerminalRaidIncoming: Villagers are returning from nearby to protect the venerated terminal!
LanguageData.RelicHuntFoundRelicSite: The relic is housed in an ancient structure protected by a multi-unit security system.\n\nYou can defeat the security forces one unit at a time, or grab the relic and try to flee before they get you.
LanguageData.RelicHuntFoundRelicSitePeaceful: The relic rests in an ancient structure nearby.
LanguageData.RitualPredictedOutcomeDescEffectRitualSp: Using ritual spot causes {0} mood bonus reduction for all participants.
LanguageData.ConnectedPawnDesc: The person this {TREE_label} is connected to. If the connected person dies, this {TREE_label} will be unable to connect to another for {DURATION}.
LanguageData.TreeBlockedByNearbyBuildingsDesc: Planting {PLANT_definite} near artificial buildings will cause its connection strength to decay over time. Connection strength determines the maximum number of dryads {PLANT_definite} can support at once.\n\nAre you sure you wish to plant here?
LanguageData.GauranlenModeChangeDescFull:
Changing {TREE_definite}'s dryad caste takes time and energy.

After the connected person interacts with the tree, all dryads will spend {DURATION} days inside cocoons while they morph to the selected caste.

Existing cocoons will cancel their transformation so they can morph to the current caste.
LanguageData.ChangeModeDesc: Change the type of dryads created by {TREE_definite}.
LanguageData.ConnectionStrengthDesc: Determines how many dryads this tree can support.
LanguageData.MaximumDryadsDesc: The maximum number of dryads this tree can support.
LanguageData.MaxDryadsBasedOnConnectionStrength: Max dryads based on connection strength
LanguageData.DesiredConnectionStrengthDesc:
{CONNECTEDPAWN_nameDef} will prune {TREE_definite} often enough to keep connection strength above this level.

Higher connection strength allows supporting more dryads, but also falls faster and thus takes more frequent pruning to maintain.

You can click on the bar to adjust the desired target connection strength.

Connection strength fall per day: {FALL}

Connection strength is affected by nearby buildings.
LanguageData.WaitingForConnectorToChangeCaste: Waiting for {CONNECTEDPAWN_nameDef} to change dryad caste.
LanguageData.GauranlenTreeModeDesc: Determines the currently created dryad caste.
LanguageData.DryadCannotChangeMaster: {ANIMAL_nameDef} is connected to {MASTER_nameDef} through {ANIMAL_possessive} Gauranlen tree. {ANIMAL_possessive} master cannot be changed.
LanguageData.ConnectionStrengthTooWeakForGaumakerPod: Connection strength too low to create Gauranlen pod.
LanguageData.NotEnoughConnectionStrengthForSingleDrya: {0} connection strength needed to support a dryad.
LanguageData.GameOverArchotechInvokedIntro: You've invoked the archonexus core. The world fills with a blinding light and time seems to slow...\n\n
LanguageData.GameOverArchotechInvokedEnding: The machine god has noticed you. Nobody can predict what happens next. It may destroy you, or communicate with you directly, or transport your consciousness to another plane of reality.\n\nYou sense a vast, inhuman structure of infinite fractal complexity flowing into your mind. Time and scale begin to dissolve. It's terrifying. It's beautiful...
LanguageData.CannotExtractSkull: Colonist is not willing to extract skull from corpse (missing pro-skullspike precept)
LanguageData.BiosculpterInteruptCycleDesc: Interrupt the current cycle. The occupant will be ejected without benefiting from the effects of the cycle, and will suffer from short-term biosculpter sickness.
LanguageData.BiosculpterUnderageAgeReversalMessage: Warning: Age reversal cycle cannot be run while biosculpter is tuned to {PAWN_labelShort} because {PAWN_labelShort} is under {ADULTAGE} years old.
LanguageData.BiosculpterLoadingStartedMessage: Once the biosculpter pod is filled with {NUTRITION} nutrition, select a colonist and right-click on the biosculpter pod or a downed person to start the cycle.
LanguageData.BiosculpterNoPowerEjectedMessage: {PAWN_labelShort} was ejected from a biosculpter pod due to lack of power.
LanguageData.BiosculpterHealCompletedWithCureMessage: {PAWN_labelShort} completed healing cycle, and their {HEDIFF_label} was cured.
LanguageData.BiosculpterAgeReversalCompletedMessage: {PAWN_labelShort} completed {PAWN_possessive} age reversal cycle. {PAWN_pronoun} expects the next age reversal in {DEADLINE} days.
